pageContext.claim: “They [the intelligence chiefs] said, 'Sir, our testimony was totally mischaracterized.' I said, 'What are you talking about?' And when you read their testimony and you read their statements, it was mischaracterized by the media.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump said the heads of U.S. intelligence agencies did not give congressional testimony that contradicted his view of Iran, the Islamic State and North Korea. But their testimony painted a sharply different view of all three: Iran as complying with the terms of a nuclear deal that Trump tore up, the Islamic State as still active despite Trump's abrupt decision to pull troops from Syria, and North Korea as still working on its nuclear weapons ambitions despite Kim Jong Un's cozy relationship with Trump.
